trans-unit.source: How to create a VNet in the Azure preview portal
trans-unit.target: How to create a VNet in the Azure preview portal

trans-unit.source: To create a VNet based on the scenario above by using the Azure preview portal, follow the steps below.
trans-unit.target: To create a VNet based on the scenario above by using the Azure preview portal, follow the steps below.

trans-unit.source: From a browser, navigate to http://portal.azure.com and, if necessary, sign in with your Azure account.
trans-unit.target: From a browser, navigate to http://portal.azure.com and, if necessary, sign in with your Azure account.

trans-unit.source: Click NEW > Networking > Virtual network, then click Resource Manager from the Select a deployment model list, and then click Create, as seen in the figure below.
trans-unit.target: Click NEW > Networking > Virtual network, then click Resource Manager from the Select a deployment model list, and then click Create, as seen in the figure below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create VNet in preview portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create VNet in preview portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: On the Create virtual network blade, configure the VNet settings as shown in the figure below.
trans-unit.target: On the Create virtual network blade, configure the VNet settings as shown in the figure below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Create virtual network blade</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Create virtual network blade</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Click Resource group and select a resource group to add the VNet to, or click Create new to add the VNet to a new resource group.
trans-unit.target: Click Resource group and select a resource group to add the VNet to, or click Create new to add the VNet to a new resource group.

trans-unit.source: The figure below shows the resource group settings for a new resource group called TestRG.
trans-unit.target: The figure below shows the resource group settings for a new resource group called TestRG.

trans-unit.source: For more information about resource groups, visit <link><linkText>Azure Resource Manager Overview</linkText><title></title></link>.
trans-unit.target: For more information about resource groups, visit <link><linkText>Azure Resource Manager Overview</linkText><title></title></link>.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Resource group</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Resource group</linkText>

trans-unit.source: If necessary, change the Subscription and Location settings for your VNet.
trans-unit.target: If necessary, change the Subscription and Location settings for your VNet.

trans-unit.source: If you do not want to see the VNet as a tile in the Startboard, disable Pin to Startboard.
trans-unit.target: If you do not want to see the VNet as a tile in the Startboard, disable Pin to Startboard.

trans-unit.source: Click Create and notice the tile named Creating Virtual network as shown in the figure below.
trans-unit.target: Click Create and notice the tile named Creating Virtual network as shown in the figure below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Creating virtual network tile</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Creating virtual network tile</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Wait for the VNet to be created, then in the Virtual network blade, click All settings > Subnets > Add as seen below.
trans-unit.target: Wait for the VNet to be created, then in the Virtual network blade, click All settings > Subnets > Add as seen below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Adding subnet in the preview portal</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Adding subnet in the preview portal</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Specify the subnet settings for the BackEnd subnet, as shown below, and then click OK.
trans-unit.target: Specify the subnet settings for the BackEnd subnet, as shown below, and then click OK.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Subnet settings</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Subnet settings</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Notice the list of subnets, as shown in the figure below.
trans-unit.target: Notice the list of subnets, as shown in the figure below.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>List of subnets in VNet</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>List of subnets in VNet</linkText>
